div.a: The Man Who Sold The End Of The World

div.div: Tim Ralston is building an empire selling the Crovel, a half-shovel, half-weapon for practical-minded doomsday preppers, spinning the American Dream out of our worst nightmares. In the woods and up the creek with the end times' greatest success story.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UJoTLV&via=Digg&text=The Man Who Sold The End Of The World

div.div: BRINING A CONTROLLER TO A GUN FIGHT

div.a: How The Gaming Industry Already Lost The Lobbying Fight To The NRA

div.div: There was one piece of legislation introduced on the Senate floor yesterday in response to the Newtown shootings. It was about video games. Why? Well, for starters, the video game lobby isn't exactly the National Rifle Association.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/URwZ4p&via=Digg&text=How The Gaming Industry Already Lost The Lobbying Fight To The NRA

div.a: Instagram Reverts Terms Of Service After Public Outcry

div.div: After changes to its terms of service caused outcry from multiple corners, Instagram has reversed course, announcing that it will be reverting the offending section back to the version in place when the service first launched.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UgurQT&via=Digg&text=Instagram Reverts Terms Of Service After Public Outcry

div.a: Who Should I Tip (And How Much)?

div.div: Tipping really is one of the most confusing customs—one that's had a long and sordid history in the US and is often the subject of heated debates. Here are some guidelines to help untangle this knotty problem.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/URg55W&via=Digg&text=Who Should I Tip (And How Much)?

div.a: Snow Fall: The Avalanche At Tunnel Creek

div.div: Just trust us and click this.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZRytCd&via=Digg&text=Snow Fall: The Avalanche At Tunnel Creek

div.div: YOU KNOW, THE DWARF WITH THE BEARD

div.a: There’s Got To Be A Way To Remember All Of The Dwarves In 'The Hobbit'

div.div: There's no mnemonic device in the world that will help you remember all the dwarves in "The Hobbit"

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UKvJAO&via=Digg&text=There’s Got To Be A Way To Remember All Of The Dwarves In 'The Hobbit'

div.div: SMALL STEP FOR MANKIND TAKES GREAT CALVES

div.a: Are You Fit Enough To Go To Space?

div.div: Doctors have taken a first stab at outlining medical advice for a type of travel that will likely become much more common in the years ahead: ordinary people taking trips to space.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UbVeNf&via=Digg&text=Are You Fit Enough To Go To Space?

div.a: The Top Five Lesser-Known Failed Apocalypses

div.div: Frequent, vigorous, nonsensical, and ultimately unsuccessful apocalyptic predictions are a part of our shared cultural heritage; making them is a tradition we're simply carrying forward.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ug44uc&via=Digg&text=The Top Five Lesser-Known Failed Apocalypses

div.a: Things Are Getting Ugly In The Custody Battle For Darwin The Ikea Monkey

div.div: The Ikea monkey's mom is mad. First, animal control officials took away her precious Darwin. Now, they won't give him back. So she decided to stage a protest with 15 friends.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VR3CPp&via=Digg&text=Things Are Getting Ugly In The Custody Battle For Darwin The Ikea Monkey

div.div: Tempests brewed in tightly shut teapots would often boil over to the rest of the Internet, engulfing people in their argument-filled tide who sometimes seemed to not even realize what they were arguing about in the first place.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12CUvI3&via=Digg&text=The Year In Internet Outrage

div.div: BETTER THAN WHAT THE KIDS ARE LISTENING TO

div.a: Spoiler Alert: First 3-D Printed Records Sound Awful

div.div: The needle drops and a series of high, repetitive whines come from the album. Then a crackling sound, and a muffled guitar riff. Finally, Kurt Cobain’s voice — audible, but distant and hollow, like he is singing in a tunnel with a scarf over his mouth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T9L5AU&via=Digg&text=Spoiler Alert: First 3-D Printed Records Sound Awful

div.div: FLAT SCREENS FOR THE END OF TIME

div.a: A Luxury Underground City Where You Can Ride Out The Apocalypse In Style

div.div: Robert Vincino owns a company that sells space in luxury survival complexes around the country. It's what he likes to call “life assurance”--mini underground cities, in effect, for people ride out the end of civilization in a community setting with good food, television, even a potential dating pool.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VStCde&via=Digg&text=A Luxury Underground City Where You Can Ride Out The Apocalypse In Style

div.div: Leave it to a bunch of scientists to figure out one of the holiday season's greatest mysteries: why Rudolph is a red-nosed reindeer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VPBVH4&via=Digg&text=Science Explains Rudolph's Red Nose

div.a: The Gun Control We Already Agree On

div.div: There's much to be discussed in the aftermath of a horrible tragedy. But surprisingly, four out of five Americans agree on one issue: common sense gun laws.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RGEI9R&via=Digg&text=The Gun Control We Already Agree On

div.div: POTATOES DON'T COMPLAIN ABOUT LEG ROOM

div.a: Boeing Uses Potatoes To Test In-Flight WiFi

div.div: The spuds were, quote, "ideal stand-ins for passengers."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UR9VD1&via=Digg&text=Boeing Uses Potatoes To Test In-Flight WiFi

div.div: Why are some mass shooters more likely to kill themselves? If we go beyond the armchair psychology and diagnostic labels in the coverage of this horrific tragedy, the data from past rampage shootings may partially reveal some motivations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SLPhZm&via=Digg&text=Why Spree Killers Kill Themselves

div.a: Behind Closed Doors At The UN's Attempted 'Takeover Of The Internet'

div.div: This is what happens when conflicting visions of the future collide.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VUj3Xr&via=Digg&text=Behind Closed Doors At The UN's Attempted 'Takeover Of The Internet'

div.div: RATION YOUR GAS, WIN THE GAME

div.a: Play The First Ever Video Game Developed In North Korea

div.div: If you saw "Pyongyang Racer" without any prior knowledge of it, you’d be forgiven for thinking it’s a product of the early 90′s or something someone learning to create games produced while reading their first Dummies Guide.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZVeVNi&via=Digg&text=Play The First Ever Video Game Developed In North Korea

div.a: MIT Discovers A New State Of Matter

div.div: Researchers at MIT have discovered a new state of matter with a new kind of magnetism.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UTeZaN&via=Digg&text=MIT Discovers A New State Of Matter

div.a: Diagnosing The Wet Bandits' Injuries In 'Home Alone'

div.div: Can a man really be hit square in the face with a steam iron and walk away unfazed? What kind of permanent physical damage would a blow torch to the head really do?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RGEkbq&via=Digg&text=Diagnosing The Wet Bandits' Injuries In 'Home Alone'

div.div: SPOILER: ENERGY HAD A BIG YEAR
In a year that saw natural disasters, the Syrian uprising, and a North Korean satellite launch, what will take the top prize?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TCWRSX&via=Digg&text=The 8 Most Disruptive Events Of 2012

div.a: Mayan Apocalypse Fails, According To Australia

div.div: Sorry to disappoint you, but it appears the world is still spinning even though Australia and New Zealand are already well into December 21.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VUc68J&via=Digg&text=Mayan Apocalypse Fails, According To Australia

div.div: How I learned to stop worrying and love the Candwich.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YowzZs&via=Digg&text=A Survival-Food Taste Test

div.a: This Rocket Could Change Space Flight Forever

div.div: In October, a small team of rocket scientists gathered in the middle of the Mojave Desert to watch a launch they hoped would help change space flight forever.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RFWnOU&via=Digg&text=This Rocket Could Change Space Flight Forever

div.a: Corrupt Apple Store Employees Come Forward Across America

div.div: We thought the crookedest little Apple Store in Texas was an isolated case. We were wrong: confessions from Apple's retail squads around the country (and world) poured in. Apple has a serious naughty behavior problem on its hands, and the Evil Geniuses are speaking out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SZxHkM&via=Digg&text=Corrupt Apple Store Employees Come Forward Across America

div.a: MySpace Tom Just Drowned A Twitter Follower In $580M Worth Of Haterade

div.div: Now we know why Tom Anderson looks so happy in that profile pic.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vb9YZa&via=Digg&text=MySpace Tom Just Drowned A Twitter Follower In $580M Worth Of Haterade

div.div: The Chinese government is rapidly building a bigger, more sophisticated military. Here’s what they have, what they want, and what it means for the U.S.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12C8q0V&via=Digg&text=Inside China's Secret Arsenal

div.div: SEEKING A FRIEND FOR THE END OF THE WORLD

div.a: 14 Best Craigslist Ads Of The Apocalypse

div.div: “It is highly unlikely the world will end Friday … but just in case you should experience the pleasure of my massage.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TZonZs&via=Digg&text=14 Best Craigslist Ads Of The Apocalypse

div.a: A U.S. Olympian's Secret Life As A Las Vegas Escort

div.div: A three-time U.S. Olympian whose illustrious running career has included a Nike TV commercial, a swimsuit calendar, and ongoing promotional work for Disney has spent the last year doubling as a $600-an-hour call girl, an astounding secret life that she now regretfully calls a “huge mistake.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UQHXHy&via=Digg&text=A U.S. Olympian's Secret Life As A Las Vegas Escort

div.a: How Canadian Police Overlooked A Serial Killer

div.div: A new inquiry has found that Canadian police grossly mishandled the case of Robert Pickton, the so-called "Pig Farmer Killer."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UfReMD&via=Digg&text=How Canadian Police Overlooked A Serial Killer

div.a: Photographs Of Wildlife In Africa Captured From Intimate Angles

div.div: Remote cameras can give photographers perspectives they ordinarily wouldn’t be able to capture, and these photographs by photographer Anup Shah show just that.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WsisOP&via=Digg&text=Photographs Of Wildlife In Africa Captured From Intimate Angles

div.div: BUT YOU STILL CAN'T LEAVE WORK EARLY

div.a: Citing End-Of-The World Rumors, Michigan Closes 33 Schools Early

div.div: More than 30 Michigan schools closed for the holidays two days early, in part because the Mayan calendar predicts the world will end on Friday, an official said.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VbuhFV&via=Digg&text=Citing End-Of-The World Rumors, Michigan Closes 33 Schools Early

div.div: Many more than 10 events took place during 2012 that reveal how science and technology play integral roles in our lives. Alas, cultural norms and conventions dictate that we stick to 10 items.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VaANwx&via=Digg&text=The Top 10 Science Stories Of 2012

div.a: The Five Most Popular Places To Watch The End Of The World
